...it's about time someone whacked Borov! If I knew who it was, I'd buy him a drink.
Yeah, it was about time.
...someone really pissed off Freedom: I heard one of their groups was destroyed in the Wild Territory...I wonder who did it?
Yeah, I wish I knew...
...finally someone had the balls to clear out the bloodsuckers in the Wild Territory... What was Duty doing all this time?
What was Duty doing? They were doing Freedom, what else?
...I heard someone whacked the leader of Freedom. They're in for some tough times I think. Duty is gonna really put a squeeze on 'em...
Let's hope so.
So you wiped out those veterans? Well done, friend! Six stalkers went missing in that area recently...we all suspected those mad veterans. It's a good thing that they've been dealt with.
Yeah, many people wanted those veterans to "leave".
You turned off the emissions at Yantar? Wow...you're a lucky nut, damn it, I'm glad that someone finally managed to deal with that thing! You can't imagine how many of our boys died there... but now the scientists will work out what it was. We might even be able to deal with the Scorcher now...
I want to believe that the Scorcher can be switched off.
What do you want? Don't you see, I'm trying to relax here...
What's new?
I hear Strelok came back. He's got all the equipment you need to get to the Machine... He's hiding now though 'cause a lot of people are after him. Some are open about it while others are trying to keep their interest a in secret. Rumour has it even Duty and Freedom have joined the hunt... each with their own agenda.
Looks like Strelok is right to hide.
What do you want?
Can you tell me anything that would be useful to a rookie?
Useful to a rookie? Well, listen up. To the North, not far from the Brain Scorcher, Freedom have set up their HQ in an old military base. They're notorious nihilists, anarchists and criminals - freedom fighters, freaking guerrillas all of them. All they do is sabotage research groups, attack army units and constantly skirmish with Duty. These skirmishes are now spilling over into a small-scale war for survival. Let me give you some advice: never get involved with them. They'll only accept you if you're totally crazy and there's a reward on your head. Ha-ha-ha. Can you believe that?
Thanks for your advice.
What do you want?
Can you tell me anything that would be useful to a rookie?
Well, there used to be this group led by Strelok. There were all sorts of legends about it going around the Zone...good and bad, but few people really knew the truth. The truth is that they wanted to deal with the Zone, find out what created it. That's why military stalkers were after them but they didn't know where to look. The government didn't want normal stalkers to know things they shouldn't have known. One day Strelok found something really important and made a move towards the center of the Zone with some of his boys. Half of the group died on the way but the rest made it through... What happened to them there - no one knows. Looks like they've copped it. The other group members were caught and killed off... I don't think there are any of them left now. Sad story, eh?
Yeah... looks like someone really doesn't want the Zone to be understood...
What do you want?
Can you tell me anything that would be useful to a rookie?
Mercs are kinda like Freedom, only worse. At least Freedom have some ideals, but these dogs, they'll do anything for money. Someone really needs to kill 'em all before they drag something really dangerous out of the Zone into the normal world! They're based in Shining Path and there's a sniper in every tall building, understand? They're not keen on strangers.
I see. Looks like you have to be careful in Shining Path.
What do you want?
Can you tell me anything that would be useful to a rookie?
If you haven't been in the Arena, I'd recommend it - it's a good way to make money and show everyone what you can do. Not everyone has the balls to fight the next monster and that's a pity! Man, as soon as I save up enough cash for decent armor, I'm there.
What do you want?
Are you Baldy? I need to talk to you.
Suppose I am. What do you want?
Spotty got saved from the Radar, but Hunchback is dead.
Dammit!
Spotty is in bad shape, his brain doesn't work anymore. Maybe you can talk to him? We need to find out the Scorcher's schedule.
No! Don't ask me to do this. Hunchback is dead 'cause of me and what happened to Spotty is my fault too. I left them, betrayed them, deserted them and ran away! I can't look Spotty in the eyes after what I did!
C'mon, chill man. Tell me what happened.
The three of us were getting ready to try to get through to the North. We didn't know when the Scorcher emissions were lower but Spotty managed to get the info somewhere...I don't know where... We were half-way through the sector, when the Scorcher suddenly switched on again. Spotty passed out straight away and fell down the hillside. I panicked and said that we should leave everything and go back. Hunchback managed to pull himself together and said that we had to get Spotty out... I said "You're an idiot, don't you wanna live? It's over for him, how are we gonna carry him all the way back?" Just as he managed to convince me and started to climb down to get Spotty... another wave came. By the time I came to my senses I was by the military base... I thought Hunchback and Spotty stayed there... but Hunchback got him out and didn't make it himself... he got him out...
OK, Baldy, OK. Calm down, man. Thanks for telling me what happened. I'll talk to Spotty myself.
Sorry. I'm not in the mood for talking... I'd rather just have another drink.
What do you want?
What's new?
There was a guy... He had a lisp and walked with a stoop so he got the name Hunchback. He was a bit crazy...talked to himself and to animals... but apart from that, he was alright. He disappeared a long time ago in the center with Strelok... they say Strelok is back now.
I wonder where he is now.
What do you want?
What can you tell me?
The Rostok factory is infested with bloodsuckers now! They come out at night. I heard there's something really important at the factory that's nearby, something essential to someone. Duty sent some guys in there recently but they all died and their screams were heard kilometers away.
Thanks for the information.
What do you want?
What did you hear?
If you go around Lake Yantar you'll come to the scientists' camp - they're do research of some sort there... They were dropped in by helicopter and they get regular supplies too. They've got a nice spot there really... You can deal with them too - they buy artifacts and might even give you a job to do.
Thanks for the information.
What do you want?
What did you hear?
Nobody has managed to get through the vehicle scrapyard because of the Brain Scorcher. Some people did see a stalker go through the invisible border, fall over, then get up in a couple of minutes and head straight for the center of the scrapyards. He ain't been seen since...
Interesting...
What do you want?
What did you hear?
Missing stalkers come back from time to time. It's a scary sight, I tell you: they mumble something and reach for their weapons, which they lost somewhere... One came to a Duty outpost some time ago and a crowd gathered to look at him. Someone even recognized him... He was scary...red eyes, all bloodshot and bruised...couldn't say a word, just moaned like an animal and went around in circles. Duty took him in, but he died after a couple of days anyway. Something happens to people in the Zone, but what is it?
I'd like to know too.
What do you want?
What did you hear?
There are a lot of zombies around Lake Yantar. They wander around and attack any human they see. If you're spotted you might wanna run for your life - there are too many of them former stalkers around there... They died at the lake and that's all that's left of 'em.
Yeah, I wouldn't want to join them.
What do you want?
What did you hear?
Traders say that there's a real treasure trove of artifacts in the center of the Zone, so anyone who makes it through will make enough money for two lifetimes. Personally, I think there's more to this. Obviously the traders think about their own interests, but there are strange rumours going around. Apparently, there's something better than artifacts there - something that ain't from this world, something alien or from another dimension altogether! They call it the Wish-granting machine. I heard a legend about a stalker who made it through. Only every time someone makes a wish the Zone grows and nobody who gets there uses his wish to make it disappear. I guess when you get to the Machine you don't give a shit about anyone else.
That's sad.
What do you want?
What did you hear?
Everyone who believes in the Monolith is completely nuts. They keep banging on about it but nobody actually knows what's in the center of the Zone. An invisible crystal that fell from the skies...ha-ha-ha! I reckon one of the secret labs blew up - I mean some stalkers used to work in a few of them. But, obviously, you can't bomb the Zone. Not only will the radiation spread all over the world, half of Europe would be flattened by the Zone's reaction. "Someone" has gone totally mad lately - I heard they're killing normal stalkers for no reason at all. How do you like that? Damn fanatics.
I think it deserves some attention.
;ãîâíîïåðåâîä
Why don't you let strangers?
Heh... where did you came from, so naive? We have a war, you know? With the bandits of Freedom. Regular skirmishes around gunmen on "Wild territory".
The war with the Freedom faction? Why?
Because the bandits of Freedom has no place in the Area, they must be destroyed. If you are interested, then ask the Barkeep, he'll explain everything, but I'm too busy for this.
And if I want to go into Duty? What should I do?
Pay fee is 10 000 rubles, and will receive a pass. With him go to the administrator of the Duty, he to you will appoint validation.
Well, here's the money.
That's great, take the admission, and run with it to the administrator Petrenko, I noted on the map. And again, don't do it in the bunker to go until you receive a pass from Ivantsova.
No, I changed my mind.
Well, it's your business, take care.
Thank you.
I need to see your boss.
Why?
I have some very useful information.
Alright, go talk to the Captain. He will tell how useful that information is.
What is that information?
Map of Shining Path. It should interest you.
Alright, you can go. The leadership is in the bunker.
Barkeep told me that your leadership has some sort of assignment for me.
Yes, he let us know about you, but before we let you in I want to brief you on our rules. So listen, our rules are simple. First rule - it's forbidden to shoot on our territory. If you break the rule twice, our patrol will open fire on you. Even if you make a run for it, you won't appear on our territory again - our guards will make sure of that. If you act calmly, you won't have any problems.
Got it. Anything else?
Yes, that's enough. You can pass.
Got it. Anything else?
That's about it. If you want to try to join Duty, feel free. We need good men but I'm warning you: before being accepted, you'll have to do a few dangerous jobs. We don't need pussies so everyone is tested.
Halt! Outsiders aren't allowed in the Duty base!
What are you standing there for? Keep moving.
Go on, bro. Remember: Duty's mission is to cleanse.
Why don't you let outsiders in?
Where did you naive boys come from? There's a war going on, right? We’re fighting Freedom bandits! We have regular skirmishes with their fighters in the Wild Territory.
A war with Freedom? Why?
Because there is no place for those Freedom bandits in the Zone - they must be destroyed. If you're interested, go ask the Barkeep to explain everything. I'm busy.
Halt! Only members can go in there! We can't let you inside the bunker without a special pass. If you want to get one go see Colonel Petrenko. He's in the administration area across the yard.
Why don't you let me into the bunker?
A pass... If we want to go, you should get special pass. Go to Petrenko, he'll explain everything.
What are you standing there for? Keep moving.
Go on. Remember: Duty's mission is to cleanse.
I want to join the Duty faction.
Go to Petrenko, he'll explain everything.
Where is he?
Inside the administration building, through the courtyard from here.
What do you want?
I'm listening.
Hello, friend.
I need to meet with your leader.
What for?
I have a map of Dead City. I think you'd be interested in it.
A map of Dead City, you say? Um... Well, let's see... Come in, he's in his bunker.
Colonel Petrenko sent me to you. Here is the permission.
Hmm. Hmm. Hmm. So, you say Duty has another optimist volunteer, huh?
Something like that.
We'll see, we'll see. But before you draw conclusions, I need you to pass a small test. You need to get the archive folder from the abandoned building across the street. The task is easy; just go inside, take the folder and bring it to me. What can be easier, right? When I have the folder, then we will decide whether you are suitable for Duty or not.
Okay, I'll be right back.
This seems too easy... I don't like it. Maybe some other time.
I've completed your mission. Here's the archive folder.
Excellent. Let's assume you've passed the test. Keep the access to the bunker. Now go to General Voronin, only he can induct you into the group.
Thank you.
What can I do for Duty?
That's a good question Messer, and there's an equally good answer to it: kill Freedom anarchists. You'll get a reward for every PDA of theirs you bring and you might get promoted too. Take all the PDAs you get to Colonel Petrenko - he gives out the rewards. Bring our fighters' PDAs to him, too, so that the information doesn't fall into the wrong hands.
I want to join the Duty faction.
A laudable desire. Colonel Petrenko and captain Ivantsov already reported about you. Before accepting you, there is one thing I need you to do.
What's that?
You see, something... Now we keep territorial fighting with a Freedom faction, and we do not have enough weapons more powerful than we have. In Freedom, there are several excellent RG-6 grenade launchers. If you managed to retrieve one for us, then I would gladly accept such a brave stalker into our group. Since you're not one of us, you can gain their trust, and then steal an RG-6 from under their noses. Well, what do you think?
I accept.
Excellent. I've uploaded the coordinates of their base in the Army Warehouses. And another tip - we have information that one of their cooks, known simply as "Chef", knows where they are and has a loose tongue. He is a drunk, so bring some vodka with you.
No, I'm not ready for such an undertaking.
It's your call.
I am ready to swear the oath.
Good man! Repeat after me: "I, a stalker known as Messer, swear to defend the goals and ideals of Duty."
I, a stalker known as Messer, swear to defend the goals and ideals of Duty.
To protect the Earth from the dangers of the Zone, to seek out and destroy anything it spawns within and beyond its borders.
To protect the Earth from the dangers of the Zone, to seek out and destroy anything it spawns within and beyond its borders.
To fight any nonconformists, be they individual stalkers or groups.
To fight any nonconformists, be they individual stalkers or groups.
And to give my life in the name of justice and order on Earth!
And to give my life in the name of justice and order on Earth!
Congratulations! You are now a full-fledged member of Duty.
I completed the mission. I brought the RG-6.
Good job. This is what we exactly needed.\nMesser, you passed the test. You are now accepted into our clan. From now on, you are a regular private of Duty. I will get some missions for you. For each of them completed, you will be rewarded and perhaps even promoted.\nTo officially become a part of our faction, you also need to swear our oath.
I've fulfilled my mission; Borov is dead and I've brought the information.
Excellent work, Marked One. You did what three of our agents were unable to do. You are a good fighter and I am glad that you are with us. For your services to Duty, I promote you to the rank of Veteran. Report to Petrenko for a well deserved reward.
I've fulfilled my mission; the Mercenary ambush was destroyed, the leader was killed, and I brought his PDA.
You've done a phenomenal job. All of our fighters can learn from you. I promote you to the rank of Keeper of Duty. Go to Petrenko, he will give you a reward.
I've fulfilled my mission. The Freedom leader is dead, and I've brought his belongings.
I am nearly in disbelief. You've destroyed the head of the anarchists. This will lead to a rapid disintegration of the group. The war is not yet over, but the outcome is already a foregone conclusion. I promote you to the rank of Master of Duty. Wear this title with honor. Petrenko will provide you with a suitable reward.
What are my current tasks?
Your task is to go to the Dark Valley, eliminate Borov, and locate all information you can about Lab X18. \n Recently, Borov's men took my scout, who carried important information about the X18 laboratory. He has probably been killed. Now, we are not ready for a large-scale war with the bandits, so your goal is Borov and the information. Find him, kill him, then get me the information about the X18 lab.
You must destroy the Mercenaries in the Wild Territory, where they've settled and have been wreaking havoc. Destroying the leader, known as Tyrant, should be enough to cause the group to disperse. Tyrant was previously a highly ranked member of Freedom; he is a known psychopath and sadist. As soon as he is destroyed, the detachment will not be so dangerous and, most likely, will retreat. Bring me Tyrant's PDA as proof that he has been dealt with. And be careful, they are known to ambush their victims.
The war with Freedom is coming to an end. You've helped our cause, but now I want to put an end to this war once and for all. I'm sending you to assassinate the leader of Freedom.
No new tasks available for now.
I'm listening.
What brings you here, brother?
You brought the RG-6?
Yes, here is the RG-6.
Good work, stalker. This is exactly what we need. Well, Messer, you carried out my request, and in return you can take this suit. I think you'll like it.
What brought you to me, brother?
The war with Freedom is coming to an end, Messer. You played your part in fighting for the cause and now I want to finish this war. I want you to kill the Freedom leader.
What brings you to me, brother? You destroyed the Freedom anarchist leader, which led to the disintegration of the group. The war is not over yet, but its outcome is already predetermined. Your merit is great, and we will not forget it.
A map of Dead City isn't interesting?
I'll give you 20,000 rubles for it.
Okay, great! Here's the map.
Here's the money. How did you manage to get it?
It's a long story.
Okay, thank you.
Wait, you have a map?!
No, I was just wondering if I should look for it or not.
Well, if you find it, come.
Did you find the map?! Marked One, give it to me! Here, these 20,000 rubles are yours. You did a great job. How did you manage to get it?
It's a long story.
Hello, stalker. Join Duty! We need good fighters! I only joined recently and look at the cool uniform they gave me!
Hello, Messer. I'm glad you're with us. Duty is really going to need good fighters soon.
Hey, fellow stalker.
Tell me about Duty.
We've been here since the beginning. The first group was made up of the surviving members of special units sent into the Zone to find out what caused it to appear. We found ourselves in pretty dire circumstances. After half of the unit died horribly, those who survived swore that they wouldn't leave here until they understood what is going on in the Zone.. until they defeat it.
Tell me about Freedom.
They're thugs who don't understand that the Zone is an ulcer on Earth's body. They want to spread it all over the world, a piece in every household. They'll do anything to achieve that goal and I can't wait to put an end to it.
You want to defeat the Zone?
Yes and we manage to a large degree. During the cleaning operations, whole swarms of mutants on the way to the Zone's center are destroyed.
Thank you.
I'd like to join the ranks of Duty.
Why?
I want to fight the zone.
Hmm... You seem like an experienced fighter. I personally believe that you can join our ranks, but you will need to prove yourself to the captain. Here's the pass. You should go to him now.
Thank you.
Piss off, Messer. We don't need thugs like you in our ranks!
Greetings stalker. Want to trade? We can do that. Want a job? We can give you a job...
How can I help?
Hello brother! What brings you to me?
What do you want?
Go on, keep moving. What are you staring at?
Hey man! I'm glad you haven't been eaten by mutants yet.
There was a massacre by the outpost. What happened?
That's the last wave of mutants that came before the blowout. It's quiet for three or four days and then there's another wave. If not for us, there'd be no Bar, there'd be no Duty; we're the last barrier in the way of these crazy mutants. A lot of our boys met their end here.
I'd like to know something.
What do you want to know?
It's my first time here. Could you tell me a little about this place?
Before the accident in '86 this was an industrial area. As you can see, there ain't much left of it now... In the basement by the hangar you'll find the 100 Rads bar. The place is run by the local trader who doubles up as a barman. If you want to trade, talk, get a mission or find out the latest news, that's the place to go. There's also the Arena where you can fight and make some cash. Duty's base is not far from the Arena. If you want to join Duty go straight over there - they'll tell you who to speak to. Oh, by the way, all of this area is protected by Duty so behave and keep your weapons holstered. If you start shooting, the patrol will "calm you down" pretty quickly.
You said there's a bar here. Can you tell me where exactly it is?
In the basement behind the hangar...I'll mark it on your map.
Thanks for the information.
You said the Duty base is here. How do I get to it?
It's not far from the Arena. I've marked it on the map for you.
Thanks for the information.
You said there's an Arena here? Where exactly is it?
Go out of the hangar with the broken roof and you'll end up right in front of it. I'll mark it on your map.
Thanks for the information.
Thanks for the information.
I'm here on business.
I take it you want something from me.
I shot down a pig on my way here. They say it's a valuable one.
I heard you shot Borov. You deserve to get some cash and a decent gun for that. Do your new weapon justice!
Don't you worry about that.
I had a little "chat" with Tyran. Basically, he understood his mistake and promised to behave in the future. I'm pretty sure he won't be breaking his word - the dead don't lie.
Tyran was a real pain in the ass for us! I'm glad you terminated him. Here is your reward - an S14 Thunder, our trademark weapon.
Not bad. I'm off to do more of the same. See you.
Didn't Voronin tell you anything?
Wow, congratulations! It's quite an achievement to kill Freedom's leader. Man, I wish I was as tough as you.
Drink a lot of milk, train, and listen to your mother. Thanks for the new gear. I'm gonna go now.
Here, another PDA delivery.
Good work.
Thanks.
There's something in my head... Agh... What's going on... I don't understand...
Uhuh... and to think.... aaah....
My head... It's full... It's full of shit... ahh....
No.... why... I don't want it... I don't want it to...
No, it won't do it to me! It won't do it to me!
I'm okay! I'm okay... I can push through this...
I can do this!
...
Good luck to you, Baldy.
Spotty, can you hear me?
No.... Why... I don't want it... I don't want it to...
Can you hear me?!
No! It won't do it to me! Not to me!
Speak to me!
My head... It's full... It's full of shit... ahh....
Waste of time! I need a scientific medkit...
There's something in my head... Agh... What's going on... I don't understand...
Here, take this medkit!
I'm normal, I'm normal... I can do this!...
Shit! I don't have a medkit... Need to ask Barkeep for one...
My head... Voices in my head... They're talking to me...
Here, take this medkit! It should help!
Gaah... My head... hurts...
How are you feeling? Can you talk?
My vision is doubling...
So it helped... What do you know bout the Scorcher? When is the radiation at its weakest?
Radiation... Screw it! Hunchback! Hunchback is dead!
Who the hell is Hunchback?
A stalker... We went together to the Scorcher... Hunchback, Baldy and I...
Baldy? Baldy was with you?
Yes... Baldy... The one with the VSK-94...
That's the guy in the bar! I gotta talk to him...
I talked to Baldy. He said you have some info about the Scorcher.
Yes... I do... It cost me quite a lot... and it wasn't completely true...
Tell me everything ya know.
I don't remember much... The radiation drops down sometimes... sometimes around the morning... sometimes around the high noon... It usually drops for an hour... sometimes more... Gahh... It's you...
What?
The voice... It's calling me... I need to go....
What are you saying?
Gaah... My head... Ahh... It's the voice again!
Calm down, friend. You're safe now.
...Whispers... Whispers... Creak of swings... My daughter... I want to see her again so much, but I can't... I can't. That THING in my head is a monster, and it turned me into a monster. No, no! My friend, give this artifact to Barkeep. It's all I found there before It got into my head. Tell the Barkeep to give it to my daughter and wife. It's the least I can do for them...
Wait, what?
Barkeep, Spotty gave me this artifact..
What artifact?
He gave me this artifact. He found it in the Radar. He told me to give it to you..
To me?
Yes. He said you should give it to his daughter and wife.
Strange... Alright, give it to me.
Here, it was his last wish.
A map of Dead City isn't interesting?
Oh, hell yes it is! Do you have one?
Yes, I've been there. What's your offer for the map?
That's incredible, Marked One. I've never seen anyone prove that they've been there. I'll pay you 30,000 rubles for it.
Deal! The map is yours.
Here's the money. So, uh... Let's see... Um... So that's where the mercenaries are, and the bandits are here! What were you doing there, anyway?
I was there on business.
Heh, well, soon stalkers will flock to this town.
I'm sorry, I changed my mind.
What, 30,000 is too little for a map?! Are you serious? I highly recommend you reconsider, and I doubt you'll find a better offer elsewhere. If you change your mind, come back here.
I'd like to know something.
What do you want to know?
Who are you and how did you end up here?
My name is Kruglov. I am a professor of biology, I study the Zone. Yesterday, for example, I found an animal of particular interest - Antropomorphus Dendromutantus Vulgaris. I mostly find and document new species of mutant animals, their traits and distinctive features. The information is then thoroughly studied and transferred to the outside world. Some of it, of course, goes to the Barkeep. My discoveries have helped to save the lives of many stalkers. I was just transporting the results of my latest research to the laboratory near Lake Yantar when the helicopter came under fire.

Tell me about the Zone.
The Zone is a wonderful gift to humanity. Of course normal existence here is not possible due to the high radiation levels, and aggressive mutants. All of these things are obviously extremely dangerous but they are also things of great scientific value. The Zone is almost a natural experiment, a treasure for scientists! The extent to which humanity's knowledge could be increased through the study of the Zone is unfathomable. Technology, medicine, new plants- medical and edible, biotechnology, cures for incurable diseases...anything! Perhaps we can solve the food problem for the entire planet. If people didn't interfere, science could lead humanity into a new Golden Era!
Duty thinks otherwise and even Freedom doesn't seem to want to help you.
You're simply incapable of grasping the whole picture. Your "here and now" problems are far more important to you than the future of humanity!
Maybe there is some use in studying the Zone.
So you understand that too? It's wonderful to discover that there are those among you who are not narrow-minded practical people. I've always said it's important to look at the whole set of issues from a broader perspective, to distance ourselves from the simple human measures. Even if the Zone has done harm to humanity, it can still be of great use to us!
Why is Freedom looking for this information?
I hope this doesn't offend you, but many stalkers are like children. They are seriously affected by things they find out. Just think of all these legends about a Monolith that grants wishes. What a joke! The problem is that these children play their games with real weapons and cause death. Childish people are often annoyed about the fact that someone doesn't share everything with them, including information that is not meant for them. There are no limits in the use of force. They shoot without thinking and kill those who study the Zone. They believe that this information will allow them to open the way to the center of the Zone. They're fools, dangerous and naive fools!
I wouldn't let legends go so easily. Someone risked their lives to bring this information to light.
I need to decipher some very important documents. Do you know who can help me with this?
Decipher the documents? Hmm... You'd better ask Sakharov, he's in the mobile lab in Yantar.
Unfortunately I have to go. Good luck.
Messer, stop them or they'll kill us!
Sit tight. We'll deal with them.
OK.
Let's move. We'll try to break through...
Let's hurry up.
Stalker, I'm begging you! I don't know who you are, but please, help us! We were returning from Yantar when these anarchists shot down our helicopter. I heard that they are looking for information but I know they'll kill us. Help me get to the lake and I'll tell you everything I know about what you call the Brain Scorcher. The Barkeep will pay you well.
OK. I'll try to help.
Thank you, stalker. I am not much of a fighter but I know the way so I'll lead and you cover us.
No, I'm not going to get a bullet. Try to get out of here yourself.
No. I am sure you don't mean that. I'll never make it out of here alone. If you change your mind, I'll be here...if I live.
Wait, what about the information?
What about the information?
What about it?! If they find out that I helped you escape, then we're both in trouble. And I'm sure they'll get their hands on it.
I'll destroy it if they attack!
No, it's too risky, you might not make it!
And what do you suggest?
I have a plan! You were taking this information somewhere, weren't you?
We were.
Let's do this: I'm gonna take this flash drive, sneak past the Freedom fighters, and take it to where it belongs. Then I'll come back to your rescue. What do you think?
Umm... this is the first time I've met you, and you're asking me to just hand you this sensitive information.
It's up to you.
Well, on the one hand, maybe you're right... I haven't much choice. Okay, I'll give it to you, but remember, this is very important information, and it should never get into the dirty paws of Freedom anarchists! I promised to give this flash drive to the Barkeep from the Stalker bar. He'll pay you well for it if you bring it to him. I'm counting on you. Also, come back soon, help us get out of here alive. We're not going to make it on our own. We are scientists, our business is scientific expeditions and laboratories...
Okay. Okay. I will do everything in my power!
Hurry, we have to get out of here quickly.
I changed my mind. Let me escort you out of here first, and then I'll take the flash drive.
I'm sorry, professor, but I couldn't keep the flash drive, they took it from me. But they let you go. Come on, let's get out of here.
Goddamn it, I can't believe they got their hands on that information. That could be the end of my career. Well... you saved our lives, and I'm grateful for that. I'm not a fighter, but I know the way so I'll lead, and you cover us on the way.
Okay, I took the flash drive to Barkeep. Now we can get out of here.
Let's go!
Phew! Have we really made it to safety? At last! Thank you so much for your help. I am in your debt but for now please accept this flash drive. It contains the results of my latest expedition. I am sure the Barkeep would pay well for it.
Ugh. Are we safe? Finally. Thank you for your help. I owe you one. That flash drive I gave you contains the results of our last expedition. I'm sure the Barkeep will pay well for this information.
Ugh. Are we safe? Finally. Thank you for your help. I owe you one. It is a pity, of course, that the results of the last expedition fell into their hands. But life is more important than that.
Yes, we're here.
Messer, if you visit our mobile laboratory, we will give you a scientific suit.
We'll see.
Hello, stalker. Allow me to express my gratitude on behalf of global science!
Messer, stop them or they'll kill us!
Sit tight. We'll deal with them.
OK.
Let's move. We'll try to break through...
Let's go.
Messer, stop them or they'll kill us!
Sit tight. We'll deal with them.
OK, I'll wait here.
Let's move. We'll try to break through...
OK, let's hurry.
Be careful with the Burner, Messer. My suit will protect me but you'd best avoid it.
Thanks for your advice.
Hurry, Messer. Now is not the time to talk.
Stalker, talk to professor Kruglov, help him get out.
It's over. They killed Kruglov!
Come to Wolfhound, our leader, he's got a job for you there.
Hey, stalker. I am Wolfhound, the leader of this pack of dogs. I think you can help us.
How's it going?
We remember your help, Marked One. Why did you come?
Yes, you're a monster. Take some time to think about joining my group. We need such people.
Hey, man. We need one thing; a small flash drive. Did you happen to come across it?
And you, man, how come? Get out of here, run!
You see, you're not from my unit, but get ready because soon the attack will start.
I'm busy, I don't have time to talk.
Like what?
Why should I help?
Do you know who caused the appearance of The Zone? Egghead assholes like these, that's who. I'm taking their top secret data that their government will hide from the public. Fuck these assholes. Turns out they had a good pilot; he managed to land the helicopter after it took a rocket, so they still have some well armed guards.
And what are you gonna do?
I have strict orders to obtain the information that they're carrying. But we don't have to fight. You're neutral, you can go negotiate on my behalf. They're trapped and they know it, and they're well aware that the clock is ticking because when night falls, shit goes to hell around here. Tell them how it is, get them to give up the info, and then maybe even these assholes will survive.
Let's say they don't give it to me, then what? Or vice versa, what would you offer me if I brought you this information?
I don't really care how you get it. Go ahead and shoot them all, my guys will even cover for you. Don't worry about the payment, we'll pay you back as expected, and you'll be on good terms with Freedom. Such opportunities don't just happen.
Alright. I'll try to get the information.
Just bear in mind that we won't wait long. And don't lie to us, otherwise that'll be the last thing you ever do.
Wait, I will not interfere.
Then get out of the way, soon things will get hot.
I prefer living as well.
So, where is the information?
Here it is.
You did your part, now listen to me. I don't carry valuable things with me in the field. Go to the bar and go to the type that sells information. He'll give you the money that's owed. Freedom remembers those who help us.
No way. Do it yourself.
Okay, let's assume you've done your part, now listen here. I don't carry valuable things with me in the field. You'll go to the bar and talk to the type that sells information. He'll give you the money that's owed. Freedom remembers those who help us.
About the job...
Well?
Almost like you predicted. Here is the information.
Well there it is. No needless deaths, so you can sleep well tonight. You've done your part, now listen here. I don't carry valuable things with me in the field. You'll go to the bar and talk to the type that sells information. He'll give you the money that's owed. Freedom remembers those who help us.
Deal. What about scientists?
What about them? We have the information, we don't need those eggheads anymore... If you want, get them out of here. Heh... I told you those assholes might survive. Whaddya know? They survived.
Alright.
I haven't got it yet.
Hurry up, time is short.
I have very urgent business, Wolfhound. Sorry but I can't help you.
Whatever, kid. Just remember that you missed your chance to earn the favor of Freedom.
A flash drive?
Yes, a flash drive. You know, where information is digitally stored. Now answer my question.
Yes, we have one.
Let's make an exchange. You give me the flash drive, and then you get walk away from this place. You won't like the other option.
I have an assignment from Lukash himself to deliver this flash drive.
Agreed.
What a clever Stalker. Consider yourself reborn today.
Thank you for the help! I'll tell Lukash that you helped us.
How kind you are. I'll remember that.
No, man, I need that information too. It won't work.
You have done a foolish thing. Take it!
You have done a foolish thing.
Oh, you bastard!
Well, okay.
Didn't find it. What's on it?
Information that we're interested in. It does not concern you. Don't let me keep you. Goodbye.
I would like to know something.
What?
Tell me about the Freedom faction.
They believe that The Zone should be free to everyone. They take an active stance against the government and anyone else who wants to lock down The Zone and keep it contained. They see it as a gift to humanity. This puts them in direct opposition with Duty.
I would like to join Freedom. How can I do this?
Come to our leader, he will decide. Perhaps you'll be given some kind of task that you'll need to complete first.
Thanks for the info.
Why are you fighting with Duty?
They're your typical closed minded ignorant selfish assholes who want to destroy The Zone, and they don't listen to reason. Destroy The Zone? Medical miracles are made here! At this rate, we'll probably cure cancer in the next 10 years thanks to The Zone! Unless Duty actually succeeds, those fucking retards. They're just like the government; they want to control everything. Only they're even dumber, since every government sees value in The Zone, but Duty doesn't.
Hmm...
Who are you and what are you doing?
Like I said, call me Wolfhound. I commanded a division in Freedom called "Dogs". Before The Zone came about, I was a well paid Mercenary. I've been to Afghanistan, Bosnia, Iraq, in a dozen hot spots, where I gained invaluable experience, a dozen scars, and two steel ribs.
Why did you go to the Zone?
In short, I was set up by one of my employers and barely got out alive. They want me dead, so I went somewhere where I'd be harder to track. There's good money to be made here, and good fighting, so everything has worked out.
Yes, The Zone is not a place for sissies.
Who are the "Dogs"?
"Dogs" is my pride. We're a special operations detachment of Freedom. Follow me into the fire, and when the smoke dies down only corpses will remain. Every fighter has personally selected. I don't just take anyone; whoever wants to join us has to prove themselves, and believe me, they will be pushed to the limit. Most will break, only the toughest can make it.
I understand.
I changed my mind.
